column5: Well I was going to Balsam unnamed Lake on Saturday....but..... woke up in the morning and felt it was cool/cold , so I I stayed in bed an extra hour got up at 6 am and started to load the boat..dang it was cold..at that point I decided not to go to balsam so off I went to unnamed simcoe.unnamed cooks bay to be exact I started catching some half descent sized bass on crank bait and plastic worms.... later I was getting taps but no hook ups..I slowed down and started getting real small bass and lots of them..it is really great to see that many small bass. if 5 or so years they will be lots of fun....I only took one picture of the small ones and a few of the bigger ones man I was not ready for how cold it was on the water..... not easy when you are by yourself... but here are some photos I stopped fishing and spent about 1.5 hours using the under water camera I saw lots of sunfish and bluegills and rock bass and largemouth bass and carp and even walleye..the walleye didn't show up too well on the video but here is a long video..you might want to just watch part of it a good day on the water thinking about winter here is the video of the queen of the ice getting her carp

LOL Terry, it makes me laugh the way you say that every time I see that video "A Carp" ha ha ha.  Some nice looking bass there and great videos  Yup, the house was cold this morning, ice fishing season is upon us
Those are some solid fish.  Nice goin
Nice fish Terry. Really enjoyed the video as well; but I think I would retire that jig  (lure)as soon as possible. lol
Very nice report bud.  BUT   YER crap.N ME RIGHT?         When I say 6am start ,you say,,,,,,            Ah never mind.
what  am at work at 6am every morning  really

Good stuff, Terry! She was a cold morning today in Ottawa when I finished my overnight shift!!  You ever take the ultralight rod out and target some of those big bull 'gills?? Would be a tonne of fun I'd imagine...and some good eats.  Great video as always..  Good Fishing,  Justin

Hi Terry your dam right it was cold out there this morning , i left home north of the city at 5 and had to scrape the windshield off on the truck , i was up at the north end of noname bay for a while this morning but spent the rest of the day in noname bay out of the wind , just came back in a few minutes ago , glad to be home. For me it seemed the perch were no where to be found today but like you the bass were hitting real good , i took the camera with me and when i had a good fish to take a picture of the dam batterys were dead in the thing , the best one  i caught to day for a Bass had his nose toughing the bottom of a five gallon pail while his tail hung over the top of it , sorry with out having a picture to show this is the best way i can tell how big it was  . All in all it was not to bad of a day ........................... i better go clean dem fish .

Awesome report, pics and videos Terry Yeah when I got up this morning, I looked outside and saw white on all the roofs that I could see from my bedroom window.... I went downstairs and looked at the thermometer from the kitchen window and it displayed 0C A frosty one for sure Jacques
Bet you were thinking DEER SEASON Jacques     .

Great Report Terry !! Those are some really nice 'eatin' Bass. I will be doing a lot of undsiclosed fishing on Lake Undisclosed in the near future That Vid is amazing too. Almost like your own personal aquarium.
